availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Alfred Franklin Gowdy (Taylor County, Kentucky, merchant)

body.p: Taylor County, Kentucky, merchant. Kentucky native. Married to Sarah Lois Hotchkiss Gowdy. Father of Alise M. Gowdy, Alfred Benoni Gowdy, David W. Gowdy, John Edwin Gowdy, Emma J. Gowdy, James T. Gowdy, and George H. Gowdy. Merchant in Taylor County in 1850. Employed J. H. Sanders as a clerk in Taylor County in 1850. Owned nine enslaved persons in Taylor County in 1850. Merchant in Taylor County in 1860. Owned nineteen enslaved persons in Taylor County in 1860.
